step1.sentence: Critical thinking is one of the most valued skills in any profession.

step2.story: She had been praised throughout school for good answers. It was only in her first job, where good questions mattered more than prepared answers, that she realized her critical thinking skills had never really been tested.

step3.story: The course had been redesigned with one explicit goal: to develop critical thinking skills rather than content knowledge. Students were evaluated not on what they knew but on how they reasoned — whether they identified assumptions, considered alternative explanations, and engaged honestly with evidence that contradicted their initial position. Faculty found the redesign uncomfortable because it required them to be genuinely uncertain in front of students. Students found it uncomfortable because it removed the option of giving a correct answer to avoid thinking. By the end of the semester, both groups reported it was the hardest and most useful course they had been part of.

meaning.shortExampleEn: The job listing required strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
